channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-16074] Reproducible failure TestReplicationHandler.doTestStressReplication
item.description:
Found this while testing Spotless, reproduces on a fresh pull of Solr. Reproduce with:

./gradlew :solr:core:test --tests "org.apache.solr.handler.TestReplicationHandler.doTestStressReplication" -Ptests.jvms=6 -Ptests.jvmargs=-XX:TieredStopAtLevel=1 -Ptests.seed=3608C7C46BF3C0B9 -Ptests.file.encoding=UTF-8

Ok after much digging, it looks like the issue stems from our upgrade of commons-io from 2.8 to 2.11: IO-751 (SOLR-15989)

Basically when we go and delete the old index after fetching a new index, one segment's file all go into read-only mode, and thus we get a AccessDenied exception when trying to write a new commit to that segment.

commons-io will have a fix in 2.12, but I'm not sure when that's going to be available.

I think we can officially call this a blocker for 9.0 as it looks like an actual issue and not just a test issue. For now we can look for a work-around until we can upgrade commons-io.

The code this stems from in Solr is StandardDirectoryFactory.removeDirectory(), so our fix should go there
Congrats on finding the cause here!  A week ago I saw this test failure and dug a bit to find the read-only files, and was dumbfounded.  Didn't have time to dig further.

Based on the linked commons-io jira:

"PathUtils.deleteDirectory(path) works correctly and does not change the target's permissions"

I know we have been slowly moving to Path everywhere. For StandardDirectoryFactory it looks like a straightforward switch. There are other usages of FileUtils.deleteDirectory that we can probably address too.

Put up a PR switching over to PathUtils. I haven't run all the tests yet but checked one of the reproductions at the top and it passed.

https://github.com/apache/solr/pull/729
